benchmark_details.name: A Large and Diverse Arabic Corpus for Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This work presents the design and development of a 500 GB high-quality Arabic corpus, comprised of 20 distinct data sources, aimed at improving cross-domain knowledge and downstream generalization capability of large language models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a large Arabic corpus to train large language models (LLMs) and to assess their performance on various NLP tasks.

data.source: The corpus consists of 20 constituent data sources, including web pages, news articles, and other content in Arabic.
data.annotation: Data was cleaned and standardized for tokenization and later usage in training models.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the performance of the models on specific evaluation tasks compared to baseline models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance on the NLP tasks evaluated.
methodology.baseline_results: Downstream tasks significantly improved accuracy compared to models fine-tuned on multi-lingual BERT (mBERT).
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated by assessing the performance on multiple Arabic NLP tasks.
